title: Verify the property tps.keep.alive.time.out_when tps.per.ticket.wait.period is very low

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. - Tp services should be started and running on the system
2. - Setup Token Printing using Manage Locations in TPS
3. - Launch PV application
- Login using valid credentials
- Navigate to 'Application Properties'
- Set the new application property 'tps.keep.alive.time.out'
- Set default value 5
4. Setup the application property 'tps.keep.alive.time.out' to very low value
5. - Reduce the value of the property 'tps.per.ticket.wait.period' to to 0
- Print the Tickts
- Verify TPS keep alive thread
6. Click on 'Logout' link
7. Verify that the connection get timeout before printing all tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. - Token Printing should be set
- Printer should be On Line
- Test Ticket should be printed successfully
3. The new application property 'tps.keep.alive.time.out' should be set
4. Application property 'tps.keep.alive.time.out' should be set
5. The 'keep alive thread' should get timed out before TPS responds
6. User should be loggedout successfully
7. The connection should get timeout before printing all tickets

title: Verify the property tps.keep.alive.time.out_when Live Print and Batch Print size larger

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. - Tp services should be started and running on the system
2. - Setup Token Printing using Manage Locations in TPS
3. Setup the application property 'bulk.print.tpservices.batch.size' value to larger (eg: 10 or 15)
4. Verify that the tickets get printed without timing out
5. Click on 'Logout' link
6. Setup the application property 'live.print.tpservices.batch.size' value to larger (eg: 10 or 15)
7. - Launch PV application
- Login using valid credentials
- Navigate to 'Application Properties'
- Set the new application property 'tps.keep.alive.time.out'
- Set default value 5
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. - Token Printing should be set
- Printer should be On Line
- Test Ticket should be printed successfully
3. Application property 'bulk.print.tpservices.batch.size' should be set
4. All the tickets should be getting printed without any timing out issues.
5. User should be loggedout successfully
6. Application property 'live.print.tpservices.batch.size' should be set
7. The new application property 'tps.keep.alive.time.out' should be set

title: Verify the property tps.keep.alive.time.out_Cable is unplugged while Printing

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. - Tp services should be started and running on the system
2. - Setup Token Printing using Manage Locations in TPS
3. - Launch PV application
- Login using valid credentials
- Navigate to 'Application Properties'
- Set the new application property 'tps.keep.alive.time.out'
- Set default value 5
4. Print Tickets after setting the property 'tps.keep.alive.time.out'
5. - Unplug the network Cable
- Make Sure that Connection between TPS and PV is lost
6. Again Plug the Cable back
7. Verify Print Tickets
8. Click on 'Logout' link
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. - Token Printing should be set
- Printer should be On Line
- Test Ticket should be printed successfully
3. The new application property 'tps.keep.alive.time.out' should be set
4. Ticket Printing (both Test Print and Live Print) should be successful
5. Print & keep alive connections gets disconnected within timeout value
6. Connection between TPS and PV should be regained automatically within the expected time.
7. Ticket Printing (both Test Print and Live Print) should be successful
8. User should be loggedout successfully

title: Verify the property tps.keep.alive.time.out

title: Printing ticket with the format having large font near to the barcode

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Do the Printer Configuration:-Configure the system Current IP in "System Administration" >> Device >> Work Station (IP Address)
2. Select the System Administration portal from the drop down list
3. Select Print Attributes tab under the Devices Menu
4. 1. Enter the details in "Print Format Design Details"
2. Select Print Format, Stock type and the Status as Active
3. Change the meta data to reflect the font size bigger than the nomal size (Attached a file with changed meta data)
4. Apply changes
5. 1.Select Event Administration and create a new event. 
2. Select the "Ticket Print Formats" same as created in step 4
3. Save the details
6. 1.Do a Ticket sale transaction for the above created event
7. Print the ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. The System Administration should be displayed with all the tabs
3. The Print Attributes should be displayed to accept the input
4. The Print Format Design Details should be get updated along with the Meta data
5. The details should be saved
6. 
7. The ticket should be printed with the bigger fonts and the text should not be cropped near to the barcode

title: Auto Config Baud Detect does not detect the correct baud.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Run TP Services 1.1.0.12
2. Right click on "System tray icon"
3. Select "Open Configuration"
4. Set BAUD rate for port used by printer
5. Click "Detect BAUD"
6. Select 9600 from BAUD drop down
7. Click "Detect BAUD"
8. Click "Update Printer BAUD"
9. Change BAUD to 9600
10. Click "Detect BAUD"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. TP Services is running
2. Menu is displayed
3. Printer configuration is displayed
4. BAUD is set
5. BAUD is detected
6. 9600 is selected in drop down
7. BAUD rate set is detected correctly
8. Option to change printer BAUD is displayed
9. BAUD rate is changed
10. BAUD is detected

1. Create an ESD and configure any extension in the same with ANY option.
2. By default SEAT option will be selected.
3. Associate event to ESD (existing set up can be used)
4. ESD should not have any ticket extensions assigned.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PV with valid credentials
2. Navigate to Ticketing setup > Access control administration portal
3. Search a supplier(Arts) using suppler search and select the supplier
4. Create a validation rule 
5. Configure ESD mentioned in pre-requisite in the ticket validation rule
6. Complete Sale for the event and Print the tickets
Note down the barcodes
7. 1. Navigate to Ticket Services -> Barcode validation page.
2. Search using the barcode.

8. Select the scan area and scan facility.
Verify whether the ticket are valid for scan
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Login should be successful and the home page of the application should be launched
2. User should be navigated to Access control administration portal
3. User should be able to select the supplier and should be navigated to page where it should show tabs:
Scan properties
Scan Facilities
Scan Areas
Scan Devices
Validation Rules
4. Validation Rules tab should be successfully selected and new rule should be created
5. User should able to associate ESD to ticket validation rule 
6. user should able to print the tickets
7. Ticket details should be displayed
8. The TICKET will show valid entry without extension since the ESD options are satisfied

title: Verify whether user is able specify the rule for  financial, attending or registered patron
custom_preconds:
Create 3 Events- EV1, EV2, EV3
Create 3 Patrons -P1, P2, P3 >> Account type is 'Business'

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PV with valid credentials
2. Navigate to Ticketing setup > Access control administration portal >> Select 'Validation Rule' tab
3. Case 1: Financial patron 
create a Validation Rule VR1 >> Patron Relationship 'Financial' and associate  ASSIGN PATRON ATTRIBUTES - BY ACCOUNT TYPE 'Business'
4. Associate VR1 to Ev1
5. complete a Sale transaction for Ev1 using Financial Patron P1
-Print the tickets and Note the Barcode
6. Navigate to ticket services-  'Validation Rule'  tab and provide the barcode Noted above.
-click on Find button
-Select the correct Scan Facility, Scan Area,Scan Date/Time
- Click on Refresh Status Button
7. Case2: Attending patron validation 

create a Validation Rule VR2 >> Patron Relationship 'Attending' and associate  ASSIGN PATRON ATTRIBUTES - BY ACCOUNT TYPE 'Business'
8. Associate VR2 to Ev2
9. 1.Complete a Sale transaction for EV2
2.Forward to Patron P2
3.Print the tickets and Note the Barcode

10. Navigate to ticket services-  'Validation Rule'  tab and provide the barcode Noted above.
-click on Find button
-Select the correct Scan Facility, Scan Area,Scan Date/Time
- Click on Refresh Status Button
11. Case3: Registered patron validation 

create a Validation Rule VR3 >> Patron Relationship 'Registered' and associate  ASSIGN PATRON ATTRIBUTES - BY ACCOUNT TYPE 'Business' and membership Program MP3 (assigned )

The Financial patron P1 should not have any membership program assigned
12. Associate VR3 to Ev3
13. 1.Lock 4 seats for Event EV3 and in cart click on Assign tickets to friend
2. Select 2 seats and assign the same to registered patron P3 ( i.2 2 tickets will be assigned to P1 and 2 tickets to P3)
3.Complete the transaction 
3.Print all  the tickets and Note the Barcode 
14. Navigate to ticket services-  'Validation Rule'  tab and provide the barcode of ticket assigned to registered patron P3 Noted above.
-click on Find button
-Select the correct Scan Facility, Scan Area,Scan Date/Time
- Click on Refresh Status Button
15. Navigate to ticket services-  'Validation Rule'  tab and provide the barcode of ticket assigned to financial patron P1 Noted above.
-click on Find button
-Select the correct Scan Facility, Scan Area,Scan Date/Time
- Click on Refresh Status Button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Login should be successful and the home page of the application should be launched
2. user is able to click on  'Validation Rule' tab
3. Validation Rule created successfully
4. Success
5. Tickets printed successfully.
6. The scan result VALID_ENTRY will be displayed
7. Validation Rule created successfully
8. Success
9. Tickets printed successfully.
10. The scan result VALID_ENTRY will be displayed
11. Validation Rule created successfully
12. Success
13. Tickets printed successfully.
14. The scan result VALID_ENTRY will be displayed
15. No rules matching the ticket should be displayed

title: Validate Scan Result Ordering of "PVND" (Entry Limit Exceeded)
custom_preconds: - purchase tickets and print to obtain ticket barcodes

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. setup the event's access control
- Valid Scans per Day: 1
- Valid Scans per Event: 2
- Valid Number of Days: 2
- Enable Exit Scanning: yes
- Ticket Validation Rules: none
- access schedule: from 2 days prior to tomorrow 7pm

day 1: 
- entry scan ticket (valid)
- exit scan ticket (valid)

day 2: 
- entry scan ticket (valid)
- exit scan ticket (valid)

day 3:
- entry scan ticket --> error PVEE
2. (continuing from above)
- modify event's access control "Valid Scans per Event" = 0 (unlimited) or > 2

- validate ticket for day 3 --> PVND
- validate ticket for day 3 after 7pm --> PVID

day 3: 
- entry scan ticket at the wrong location (facility, area) or time 
3. repeat but use Ticket Validation Rule
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. "PVND" should be after (eg) "PVEE" - entry limit exceeded per event or "PVED" - entry limit exceeded per day or various invalid ticket results (e.g., PVRP - reprinted, PVVD - voided)
2. "PVND" should be before (eg) "PVAE" (Ticket Already Entered) or various invalid location/time results (e.g., PVLIT, PVID)
3. see above

title: Validate Scan Result Ordering of "PVND" (Entry Limit Exceeded) Across Multiple Validation Rules
custom_preconds:
- purchase tickets and print to obtain ticket barcodes
- create multiple validation rules (see add'l variables per step)
   - valid scans per day, valid scans per event = 0 (unlimited)
   - valid number of days = 1
- add the validation rules to the event where validation rule 1 is first and validation rule 2 is second
- event's access control setup: 
   - schedule: -2 days to +1 day 
   - valid scans per day, valid scans per event & valid number of days = 0 (unlimited)
   - enable exit scanning = true

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. setup validation rule 1 to be restricted on schedule 
setup validation rule 2 to be restricted on number of days
day 1: scan ticket (entry & exit)
day 2: validate & scan ticket
2. setup validation rule 1 to be restricted on number of days = 1
setup validation rule 2 to be restricted on scans per event or day = 1, number of days = 2
day 1: scan ticket (entry & exit)
day 2: validate & scan ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. "PVND" should be before "PVLIT" or "PVLID" (valid location but invalid time or date)
Thus, either "PVND" should be the final/overall scan result
2. "PVND" should be after "PVEE" or "PVED" (exceed limit per event or day, respectively)
Thus, either "PVEE" or "PVED" should be the final/overall scan result

title: Verfiy the can access reset scans utility for Channel-Agency-User(Inheritance and over riding)

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PV with valid credentials
2. Select Application feature permissions from System setup
3. Select Set/Modify as Common system permissions
4. Verify whether the Can Access Reset Scans Utility is shown
5. Select the Channel by searching
6. The default value of Can Access Reset Scans Utility should be  false
Make sure that  the Agency and User levels inherit the above  action
7. Logout and Login to PV with valid credentials
8. Select Utilities portal
Verify whether  "Scan Reset" utility is available of utility dropdown
9. 1.Select AFP
2.Select Common system permission
3.Select channel
4.Check the checkbox of Can Access Reset Scans Utility  for Channel and Click  apply changes 
5.Make sure the agency and user inherit the setting in channel level
10. Logout and Login to PV with valid credentials
11. Select Utilities portal
Verify whether  "Scan Reset" utility is available of utility dropdown
12. Override the Can Access Reset Scans Utility in agency level by checking the checkbox
User should inherit the access
Apply changes
13. Logout and Login to PV with valid credentials
14. Select Utilities portal
Verify whether  "Scan Reset" utility is available of utility dropdown
15. Repeat the step 13 and 14 by setting AFP  Can Access Reset Scans Utility by:
1.      Channel has access, agency inherited access, user overridden 
2.      Channel has access, agency overridden access, user overridden
3.      Channel has no access, agency inherited access, user overridden
4.      Channel has no access, agency overridden access, user overridden
5.      Channel has access, agency inherited access, user inherited
6.      Channel has access, agency overridden access, user inherited
7.      Channel has no access, agency inherited access, user inherited
8.      Channel has no access, agency overridden access, user inherited
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Login should be successful and the home page of the application should be successfully launched
2. Application feature permissions portal should be successfully selected
3. Common systmes permissions should be displayed
4. Can Access reset scans utility should be shown
5. Channel should be selected
6. The default value of Can Access Reset Scans Utility should be  false (Checkbox unchecked)
Agency and User should inherit the the setting in channel level
7. Login shoudl be successful
8. Scan reset utility should not be displayed in dropdown
9. The changes should be successfully saved
Agency and user should inherit the settings in channel level
10. Login should be successful
11. The scan reset utility should be available in utility dropdown
12. Changes should be successfully saved
13. Login shoudl be successful
14. Scan reset utility should  be displayed in dropdown
15. The utility should be present in the dropdown only when the access is set and it should not be available in the dropdown when the access is not set.
